TopicTitle: Which space shuttle should I make

Articles.Content:
Recently I got the urge to build one of these Revell model airplane sets I used to love as a kid. So after getting my paycheck I went over to the hobby store and found....

A Space shuttle Model kit! I immediately purchased it and started building. The box said it was Atlantis but after inspection I found decals for all the shuttles.

the model is now nearly done and it's time for me to choose which decals I want on the ship. So why not let the KSP community vote on it!

whichever shuttle has the most votes when I'm done with the construction is gonna be on the model (Pics will follow)
I went for Columbia, mostly because Discovery, Endeavour and Atlantis look virtually the same while Columbia has the cool looking black parts near the top of its wings.

Discovery has always been my favorite for some reason, but Columbia is good as well.

I notice Enterprise is missing from the list, though.
Endeavour! why?.... I like how it sounds and i can't stop repeating it

Buran

So just leave the pieces laying around?

So just leave the pieces laying around?

Lol

I chose Endeavour, since it's on display at a local* museum.

*70 miles is close...

Even though I don't have the decals for mine (they weren't in the box) I made mine like Discovery. It is my personal favorite, I saw it sitting on the pad before STS-114. It is the first shuttle launch I saw (Not IRL though, on TV), I also watched the landing live. It is the longest operating orbiter (if not surpassed by Columbia). I also saw it on display at the Udvar-Hazy Museum a few years back. Not that is has anything to do with anyone else, its just my favorite
Endeavor is the one they built after Challenger blew up, correct?
Atlantis is my personal favourite, so my vote goes to that.

Endeavor is the one they built after Challenger blew up, correct?

Correct.

OV-105 was largely built of structural spare parts after the loss of OV-99.

Correct.

OV-105 was largely built of structural spare parts after the loss of OV-99.

that's what I thought, but something made me doubt myself
